Most of the kernels are derived from Beta Kernels. 
Up to a proportionality factor (so that $\sum_{j=-h}^h\kappa_j=1$) the coefficients of this kernel are:
$$
\kappa_j = \left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert^r
\right)^s
$$
The kernels used in `rjdfilters` are:

<div class="col2">

- $r=1,s=0$ uniform kernel: 
$$\kappa_j^U=1$$

- $r=s=1$ triangle kernel:
$$\kappa_j^T=\left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert
\right)$$

- $r=2,s=1$  Parabolic (or Epanechnikov) kernel:
$$\kappa_j^E=\left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert^2
\right)$$

- $r=s=2$ biweight kernel:
$$\kappa_j^{BW}=\left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert^2
\right)^2$$

- $r = 2, s = 3$ triweight kernel:
$$\kappa_j^{TW}=\left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert^2
\right)^3$$

- $r = s = 3$ tricube kernel:
$$\kappa_j^{TC}=\left(
  1-
  \left\lvert
  \frac j {h+1}
  \right\lvert^3
\right)^3$$

- Gaussian kernel:
$$
\kappa_j^G=\exp\left(
-\frac{
  j^2
}{
  4h^2
}\right)
$$
- Henderson kernel:
$$
\kappa_{j}=\left[(h+1)^{2}-j^{2}\right]\left[(h+2)^{2}-j^{2}\right]\left[(h+3)^{2}-j^{2}\right]
$$

- Trapezoidal kernel:
$$
\kappa_j^{TP}=
\begin{cases}
  \frac{1}{3(2h-1)} & \text{ if }j=\pm h 
  \\
  \frac{2}{3(2h-1)} & \text{ if }j=\pm (h-1)\\
  \frac{1}{2h-1}& \text{ otherwise}
\end{cases}
$$
</div>
We have:
$$
\kappa_j^{TC}
\leq\kappa_j^{TW}
\leq\kappa_j^{BW}
\leq\kappa_j^E
\leq\kappa_j^T
\leq\kappa_j^U
$$
